item.title: Afternet.org via SSL on Ubuntu with X-Chat
item.description: Reference (but it‚Äôs vague): http://www.afternet.org/help/connecting/ssl NOTE: AfterNET is adding a wildcard SSL certificate. This may obsolete these instructions. 1. Download the certificate. 2. Create a folder afternet.org under /usr/local/share/ca-certificates/ 3. Copy afternet.cer to /usr/local/share/ca-certificates/afternet.org/ 4. Symlink it as 90511bdb.0 5. run update-ca-certificates to update the certificates list. 6. Open x-chat. 7. Edit your AfterNET entry. 8. Remove all the old servers and instead add. 9. Check both Use SSL for all Servers on this Network and Accept invalid SSL certificate.

item.title: Nook and Emscripten: A technical look at C++ GameDev in the Browser
item.description:
I run an online game-jam event called Ludum Dare, and this past weekend I got together with a friend (Derek Laufman of Halfbot) and we made a game. What did we make? A platformer about size.

The game was created over a period 72 hours. Somehow, amazing to me, we managed to pull it together despite our responsibilities.

  • Me running the event (Ludum Dare)
  • Family gathering at my brothers I attended on the Saturday
  • Car appointment on Monday
  • Derek taking care of his baby

Fortunately, running Ludum Dare is only busy for me before the event, and at submission time (two of them, 3-5 hours each). During the event I‚Äôm free to sit down and do whatever I want. This weekend was the Diablo 3 beta test, and if I was a lesser man, I‚Äôd have played that. Fortunately for me, Derek came to me a couple weeks ago and suggested we make a game together, I said yes, and the rest is history.

It‚Äôs totally silly, but I‚Äôm actually proud of the fact that I managed to attend the family gathering and the car appointment. Stupid me, I could have actually cancelled/rescheduled the appointment for Tuesday or Wednesday, but I decided to go ahead with it anyway. The car appointment was my yearly service for my smartcar, and I ended up staying in the neighborhood of the dealership for about 5 hours of that day. Working on my Ludum Dare game on my laptop, I had WIFI at the dealership, and also McDonalds, where I parked myself for a couple hours. To be honest, this was probably the first time I seriously ‚ÄúCoffee Shop Developed‚Äù, and where I actually got some serious work done. It was fun, because it was out of the ordinary. üôÇ

Anyways, that‚Äôs enough back story. Lets get nerdy.

item.description:
I‚Äôve been doing my daily logs over at the Ludum Dare site, to try and encourage more people to participate there. I‚Äôve really only worked on the game for 2 days, despite my plans to start early. Today I was busy with something else, so this week‚Äôs update will be light.

There‚Äôs currently no UI, but I can cycle tiles with the mouse wheel. It auto saves/loads the map to a specific file.

So Intel ended up covering my flight, putting me up in a fancy hotel, gave me some spending money, treating me to dinner, AND giving me nearly front row seats to a San Jose Sharks hockey game!

item.title: Personalizing your GDC pass
item.description: Ordinarily, greeting someone by glancing at their chest might be seen as a little rude (especially a lady), but at GDC it‚Äôs encouraged! Yes I‚Äôm talking about the passes, not making a pass. The passes do a good job of helping you connect a face to a name, and even a company, but you don‚Äôt always know who made or represents what. GDC passes include a relatively large pocket, so you could either make something to insert behind your name card, or cover the pass with some strategically placed stickers.

item.title: A Very Different GDC (for me)
item.description: So last year, I was an IGF Mobile finalist. This little game of mine stood alongside iPhone favorites like Edge and Fieldrunners, vying for the ‚ÄúBest Mobile Game‚Äù award. And if I had won, ‚Ä¶ well, I have no idea. Even just being a finalist has been great for me, so I‚Äôd image it would have been MORE great. üòâ That was 2009, and this is 2010. This year started out as my ‚Äúlow key‚Äù and ‚Äúquiet‚Äù GDC.

item.title: Ludum Dare 16 Results are Live!
item.description: I know it‚Äôs hard to compete with the wake of the IGF Finalists announcement yesterday, but the Ludum Dare 16 winners were announced yesterday too. Go here for the Top 20: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-16/?action=top Here for the categorical listings: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-16/ And here for the news post: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2010/01/03/ludum-dare-16-results/ Trying to compete with the IGF Buzz would be silly, so I‚Äôm going to push back my little LD retrospective until things are a little more calm.

item.title: Mike’s 2009
item.description: So wow. That‚Äôs finally it for 2009. Like doing taxes ever year, I feel a special sort of obligation that I write some sort of retrospective, especially after such an eventful year as this one. Far more awesome than taxes. üòâ I wasn‚Äôt sure where to start, so I ended up categorizing aspects of the year. I‚Äôll free form rant about each topic as I come to it. Let‚Äôs begin.

item.title: A Port and a Compo
item.description: Wow. To say the last 3 weeks have been busy would be an understatement. First of all, I ported Smiles to a new phone. The Samsung Omnia II, a Windows Mobile phone with a beautiful amoled screen and a custom GPU. Some photos. For those keeping score, the game unfortunately runs a little slow on the Omnia II. It‚Äôs definitely playable, but the GPU is no PowerVR SGX. I did what I could in the time I had, optimized my shaders and all that, but it‚Äôs what it is.

item.title: Ludum Dare 16 Announcement
item.description: Today we announced the date for Ludum Dare #16. This upcoming December 11th-13th weekend. Ludum Dare is that other thing I do. Along with Phil, Mike and Seth, we run a community website based around the infamous Ludum Dare competition. Game developers from around the world assemble, pick a theme, and make a game from scratch over the weekend. Then we vote on our favorites. http://www.ludumdare.com/‚Ä¶/announcing-ludum-dare-16-december-11th-13th-weekend/ Nowadays, we do it 3 times per year, this one being our regular December competition.

item.title: Ludum Dare 15 was huge-er!
item.description: Wow! Ludum Dare #14‚Äôs 123 entries in April was a pretty big deal, but our 15th Ludum Dare in August did a whopping 144! Yikes! http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-15/?action=preview On the plus side, Phil and I came together and awesome-ified the website. He wrote our all new voting and submission system, and I made the site look new and purty. And when all was said and done, it actually worked! Wow! It came together the weekend before the competition.

item.title: A trailer and a compo
item.description: Yes yes, I‚Äôm awfully quiet. What else is new? Let me tell you. First things first, a brand new trailer for Smiles. Why does Smiles need a new trailer? I‚Äôll tell you when you‚Äôre older. This ended up taking a couple weeks longer than I‚Äôd hoped it would (spontaneous summer vacation?), but it‚Äôs done. The new trailer combines the tidbits dropped in the last post (mushroom animation, new logo), some gameplay footage, and a nice audio track.

item.title: First, the other stuff
item.description: Crawling out of bed early this morning, I made the weird decision that it‚Äôd be a blogging morning. It seems I‚Äôve stockpiled a few interesting things to talk about. I‚Äôm nearly ready to start talking about the new project too, but as the title suggests, I‚Äôll be talking about the other stuff today. First thing on the agenda, Ludum Dare. I wanted to follow up that prior post of mine with a brief finale post.

item.title: Ludum Dare 14 was huge!
item.description: Wow! So, I have no idea what just happened, but Ludum Dare 14 was our biggest yet. With 121 entries from around the world, that‚Äôs a-lot!! From my quick check, the highest we‚Äôve had to date was high 60‚Äôs (though I was pretty sure we did an 80 entry compo at one point). *shrugs* I started on an entry on Saturday, but didn‚Äôt get all that far. Friday (besides taxes), I was caught up administrating, making sure the whole thing actually happened.

item.title: Ludum Dare 14 This Friday
item.description: Just a quick note. Ludum Dare 14 is this Friday. It‚Äôs usually Phil and I that run the compo (with Mike and Seth, and our awesome community of regulars), but IGF Champion and Goat Owner Extreme Phil Hassey is off on his North American Tour next week, leaving me to see if I can remember how to use all his compo scripts. üòâ If you‚Äôre not familiar with Ludum Dare, we‚Äôre probably the oldest make a game in 48 hours competitions on the internet.

item.title: Smile Zen and Drop Available, News
item.description: It‚Äôs been 2 weeks, and much has happened. As the topic suggests, Smiles Drop and Smiles Zen are now both available. $2.99 each, or save $1 by getting Smiles ($4.99). So yeah, in a way that means I technically have 3 games out. As for blog content, I‚Äôm half way through a post on what went in to creating the video. Actually I was half through the Friday of the last post, but got caught up in the fact that I could actually take it easy for a couple days‚Ä¶ and I sorta haven‚Äôt gone back to finish the post yet.

item.title: Getting Close
item.description: Still doin‚Äô the perpetual ‚Äúone more week‚Äù, but I‚Äôm close. Very close. If things go according to plan, we‚Äôll be beta next Monday (September 1st). I want to sit on it a couple days and test the crap out of it, just to be sure it‚Äôs all good. Then off to Apple by Wednesday-Friday. I wanted the promo+box art done a couple weeks ago, but I amusingly keep pushing it back.

item.title: I make games to piss you off
item.description: Slightly off topic today. Well, if you‚Äôre expecting mystery iPhone game news that is. The weekend ended up being a little more slack-tastic that I‚Äôd hoped. Ludum Dare 12 after all, which always keeps me busy. With only a couple hours left, I decided I‚Äôd throw something together quickly. Well, those couple hours went very well. With so little time, I obviously couldn‚Äôt make anything extravagant. What I ended up with was a game best described as ‚Äúa game designed to piss you off‚Äú.

item.description: Avert your eyes. Nothing to see here. Move along. I‚Äôm going to stop pretending I know when I‚Äôm ready to show. item.description: I‚Äôll get back to the series eventually. I was expecting to work and talk about new engine stuffs. item.description: Start the year right ‚Äòeh? I think each year I‚Äôve had a blog, I‚Äôve told myself ‚ÄúYes sir! This year we‚Äôre going to blog more often‚Ä¶ and it‚Äôs going to be great!‚Äù. item.title: Ludum Dare #9: “Build the Level You Play”
item.description: The compo is going ahead full force, despite our complete lack of publicity and organization. The theme is ‚ÄúBuild the Level You Play‚Äú. In other words, design a game leveraging user creation or user created content, or a game of building. Line Rider, PuffBOMB, The Incredible Machine, and much more. We‚Äôve seen some pretty exciting ideas discussed in IRC, so don‚Äôt miss out. Sign up, blog, and upload here: 48hr.thewavelength.net
